etymologies: late 16th century (in an earlier sense). From classical Latin dēlectus (also dīlectus) selection, choice, (specifically) selection of soldiers by conscription, military draft, body of men enrolled, levy from dēlect-, past participial stem of dēligere to choose out, select (from de- + legere to gather, cull, choose) + -tus, suffix forming verbal nouns

definitions: Enlistment or conscription of soldiers; an instance of this, a military draft.
A selection of texts or extracts from a larger work or collection; specifically a selection of Latin or Greek passages from various authors, intended for translation.
